Description: Part of a dark brown, plaited woven strap made of goat hair, incomplete at both ends. The strap is woven in regular twill weave producing a characteristic 'herringbone' appearance. Each element passes over two other elements then under two elements in an offset pattern (2/2 twill). There are eleven thread elements. Each thread element consists of 4 'z'-plied yarns twisted in 's'- direction. Several short strips of leather are present and are the remains of decorative stitching or of stitching used to strenghten the strap.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kulubnarti, 21-S-2 Terrace west of House A-1 Fill
Bibliographic references: Adams & Adams 1998 / Kulubnarti II, The Artifactual Remains (p. 58, 76-77, 120, pl. 7.2E)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 85.2.81 (excavation object cat. no.)
